data: Consider droplet precautions if influenza suspected, and airborne precautions if TB suspected

Assess severity and risk stratification using CURB-65 Scoring (1 point for each)  - Confusion (MMSE less than 9 or new disorientation)  - Urea greater than 7 mmol/L  - Respiratory rate greater than 30 breaths per minute  - SBP less than 90 mmHg or DBP less than 60 mmHg  - Age greater than or equal to 65 years
Review antibiotic exposure within past 3 months and select a different antibiotic class when possible

Assess after 48 hours. Consider switching to oral antibiotics if the following step down criteria are met:   - Intact GI absorption    - Improving symptoms (cough, respiratory distress, shortness of breath)    - Absence of fever for 12 hours or more (less than or equal to 38 degrees Celsius)     - WBC normalizing
For patients with renal impairment, consider adjusting antibiotic dose according to creatinine clearance
For CURB-65 Score of 2 or less
amoxicillin-clavulanate 875 mg-125 mg tab (dosed as amoxicillin)
